issuer_name: Canadian Apartment Properties Real Estate Investment Trust

dilution_detail.reconciliation_note: Detailed dilution breakdown not disclosed. Estimated from weighted average units.

liquidity.data_source: Q4 2024 Annual Report - Note 12 Credit Facilities. Credit Facilities: Acquisition & Operating Facility $600M limit, drawn $5,019k (less than 1%), GHG Reduction Facility $70M (not drawn), ERES Credit Facility â‚¬62M.

data_quality.source: Q4 2024 Annual Report - Phase 1 markdown conversion (304KB file)
data_quality.validation_notes: CAPREIT uses non-standard terminology: 'Normalized FFO' instead of FFO/AFFO. This REIT experienced an 84.5% distribution cut in January 2025 (cut_date: 2025-01, observation date: 2024-12-31). Financial metrics extracted from markdown file with some estimates due to table formatting issues in PDF conversion. Key confirmed values: Total Assets $16.5B, Investment Properties $14.9B, Mortgages Payable $6.0B, Credit Facilities $5M, 46,900 suites, 98% occupancy. Net loss of $132M in 2024 driven by fair value adjustments. Large disposition program with $875M in proceeds.

extraction_notes.distribution_cut_context: Observation 8 in Phase 1B dataset. CAPREIT cut distributions by 84.5% in January 2025 following Q4 2024 results. This represents one of the largest distribution cuts in the Phase 1B training dataset.
extraction_notes.terminology_note: CAPREIT uses 'Normalized FFO' (formerly NFFO) and reports ACFO but not standard AFFO per REALPAC.
extraction_notes.european_operations: CAPREIT has significant European operations through ERES (European Residential REIT) with EUR-denominated assets and mortgages. Cross-currency swaps in place.
extraction_notes.portfolio_repositioning: Active capital recycling program: sold 16,859 non-core suites/sites in 2024 for $875M+, acquired 1,286 high-quality suites. Strategy focused on upgrading portfolio quality.
extraction_notes.ncib_program: Normal Course Issuer Bid active - purchased units for cancellation in 2024.
extraction_notes.cmhc_insurance: Significant use of CMHC-insured mortgages. Prepaid CMHC premiums of $110M being amortized.
